handle.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to do the things that are necessary to complete a job
handle.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: I handled most of the paperwork.
The case is being handled by a top lawyer.
The finance department handles all the accounts.
Computers can handle huge amounts of data.
handle.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to deal with a situation or problem by behaving in a particular way and making particular decisions
handle.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The headmaster handled the situation very well.
I knew I had handled the matter badly.
Leave it to me. I can handle it.
Most customers were satisfied with the way their complaints were handled.
Opposition leaders will be watching carefully to see how the prime minister handles the crisis.
handle.translation[0].definitions[2].def: to deal with a person or behave towards them in a particular way, especially in order to keep them happy
handle.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Some customers are quite difficult to handle.
handle.translation[0].definitions[3].def: to not become upset in a difficult situation
handle.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: She can’t handle it when people criticize her.
He doesn’t handle stress very well.
handle.translation[0].definitions[4].def: to touch something or pick it up and hold it in your hands
handle.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: He had never handled a weapon before.
We teach the children to handle the animals gently.
He was roughly handled by the mob.
handle.translation[0].definitions[5].def: to control the movement of a vehicle or an animal
handle.translation[0].definitions[5].exa: I didn’t know if I’d be able to handle such a large vehicle.
handle.translation[0].definitions[6].def: the way a vehicle handles is how easy it is to control
handle.translation[0].definitions[6].exa: The car handles well, even on wet roads.
handle.translation[0].definitions[7].def: to move goods from one place to another
handle.translation[0].definitions[7].exa: The Post Office handles nearly 2 billion letters and parcels over the Christmas period.
handle.translation[0].definitions[8].exa: Bennet was charged with handling stolen goods.
handle.translation[1].definitions[0].def: the part of a door that you use for opening it
handle.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Then he turned the handle and went in.
handle.translation[1].definitions[1].def: the part of an object that you use for holding it
handle.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: a knife with a carved wooden handle
handle.translation[2].definitions[0].def: to deal with a difficult situation or problem
handle.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: First-time travelers get some peace of mind when an agency handles everything.
handle.translation[2].definitions[1].def: to deal with a particular client or product
handle.translation[2].definitions[1].exa: She handles all our major clients.
handle.translation[2].definitions[2].def: if you handle a particular job, you are responsible for doing it
handle.translation[2].definitions[2].exa: He will handle merchandising and advertising as well as retaining his duties as president.
handle.translation[2].definitions[3].def: to buy, sell, or deal with goods or services in business or trade
handle.translation[2].definitions[3].exa: Domestic car manufacturers have said their dealers are free to handle foreign cars if they wish.
handle.translation[2].definitions[4].def: to move goods etc from one place to another
handle.translation[2].definitions[4].exa: We handle large volumes of imported goods.
